Detailed Description

Describes one landmark.

Used when expanding the route.

Definition at line 29 of file LandmarkLink.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

LandmarkLink::LandmarkLink (  ItemTypes::lmdescription_t  description,
int32  dist,
bool  distUpdated = false,
const char *  name = ""
) 
 

Create a new landmark in the route.

Parameters:
description The landmarkdescription for this landmark, e.g. from the lmTable in a map.
dist How far on a route-item is the landmark located. Intitate to m_dist of the routeitem.
distUpdated Default false, set to true when the route-item this landmark belongs to has been concatenated with another routeitem.
name The name of this landmark.

Delete this object and release the memory allocated here.

Definition at line 195 of file LandmarkLink.h.

bool LandmarkLink::getRouteDescription (  uint32  descProps,
char *  buf,
uint32  maxLength,
uint32 &  nbrBytesWritten,
StringTable::stringCode  turncode = StringTable::NOSTRING
) 
 

Creates a description of this landmark, text formatted, to be used in the route description.

Examples: "After 15 km pass Landskrona" or "Then turn right after Allhelgonakyrkan on your left side".

Parameters:
descProps Route description properties (bitfield) that that indicates which information that should be included in the route decription.
buf Preallocated buffer which will be filled with the description.
maxLength The length of buf.
nbrBytesWritten The number of bytes written into buf.
turncode The turn, which this landmark is associated with.
Returns:
True if the route description did fit in the buffer, false otherwise.

bool LandmarkLink::getRouteDescription (  const DescProps &  descProps,
char *  buf,
uint32  maxLength,
uint32 &  nbrBytesWritten,
StringTable::stringCode  turncode = StringTable::NOSTRING
) 
 

Creates a description of this landmark, text formatted, to be used in the route description.

Examples: "After 15 km pass Landskrona" or "Then turn right after Allhelgonakyrkan on your left side".

Parameters:
descProps Route description properties (bitfield) that that indicates which information that should be included in the route decription.
buf Preallocated buffer which will be filled with the description.
maxLength The length of buf.
nbrBytesWritten The number of bytes written into buf.
turncode The turn, which this landmark is associated with.
Returns:
True if the route description did fit in the buffer, false otherwise.

Get the streetname of a traffic lm.

Null if missing.

Definition at line 158 of file LandmarkLink.h.

bool LandmarkLink::m_endLM [private]
 

Is this landmark an endLM, i.e.

at the end of a route-item. Affects the description; if the landmark is a endLM no distance "After x meters" is stated, instead the turndecription from the description of the lm's route-item is repreated e.g. "Then turn left".

int32 LandmarkLink::m_lmDist

Definition at line 111 of file LandmarkList.h.

bool LandmarkLink::m_lmDistUpdated
 

States whether this landmark's m_lmDist has been updated or not during use in the ExpandRouteProcessor.

If the route-item to which this landmark belongs is concatenated with another route-item, the landmark's m_lmDist is also updated. If the m_lmDist has been updated it should _not_ be changed if more route-items are added after the landmarks's route-item, but should if more route-items are added before the lm's route-item.

Definition at line 123 of file LandmarkList.h.

The name of the landmark.

Definition at line 130 of file LandmarkList.h.

char* LandmarkLink::m_lmName [private]
 

The name of the landmark.

The same as the landmark item name if the item has a name, else e.g. "the railway"
